result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon Ray Williams Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Defendant is advised he/she may not possess any firearms
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with victim and child; if there is an issued; Court will authorize probation agent to reinstate the NO CONTACT ORDER immediately.

- Complete Batterers Intervention Class.
- Mental Health Assessment.
- Court suggest a parenting class and individual therapy.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon Ray Williams Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damon Ray Williams Sr in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by e-mail for Damon Ray Williams Sr.  Attorney Clair Zyber an Michael Odden appeared by e-mail for State of Wisconsin. Branch 10 in trial on another case. Defense requests adjournment. Case adjourned in Branch 10.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defendant's elements of the offense

Defendant Damon Ray Williams in court with Attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Attorney Mogren is new counsel for the defense and requests a plea/sentencing date.  Alleged victim is present and requests modification of the no contact order to a no violent contact order.  Arguments heard.  Court denies request for modification at this time.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Damon Ray Williams in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears pro se.  He does not qualify for public defender representation and is requesting the court appoint an attorney.  Court will appoint an attorney.  Case is adjourned to 7-18-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel, by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Damon Ray Williams in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Damon Ray Williams in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damon Ray Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
